page.title: 01SW Isle of Cumbrae
page.content: The Isle of Cumbrae is basically a holiday island serving tourists from central Scotland. Soputh west covers residential houses with two medium sized farms, 3 hotels and 2 caravan parks containing approx. 250 residential caravans. The land area comprises farmland, playing parks, golf course (18 hole) 3 bowling greens, boatyard and some shops. The coast line is of a rocky nature with one large snady beach at Fintray Bay. The main reservoir supplying Millport town with water is situated at the golf course and the old and new cemetaries are included in the area. Most of the land is arable or grazing with little scrubland except neat thte shoreline.
